bColA8Q8LpsMnRQkZWcP0A.text: I stopped in at La Unica a few weeks ago. We were driving by and noticed this new Restuarant and thought we should try it. My first impression was that it's very nice inside and the staff was very friendly. However they had very slow service and not many people were seated. We got our food and my husbands chicken was over cooked and dry. I had ordered the fish tacos and they were very good in taste however I noticed something crunchy. I wasn't sure if it was bones or what but I ended up not eating them. I was dissappointed because this restuarant was so close to our home and there's not that many Mexican restaurants near to our home. I will probably try this place again but order something different.

KFz5c32pmddK3jxDLrW8Nw.text: This was our first time going to La Unica in Ballantyne since they opened. We were a group of 5 and all of us had an extremely delicious dinner. We had tacos, nachos, homemade chicken soup (to die for) and huevos con chorizo. Everything was superb and very reasonably priced. To top off the wonderful dining experience we met Edgar who periodically checked on us to ensure we were experiencing a pleasant dining experience. Muchas Gracias!

xEUzpihgYLNwV5XtZAJjgA.text: I am so excited that they have opened a La Unica here in Ballantyne!!! I used to live in Huntersville and ate at that one 2-3 times a week. Tried out the new location tonight and was very pleased. We got a table right away and had chips and salsa immediately. Their salsa is so good that I used to get it to go for any time I was making Mexican at home and it's just as going at this location. Our server was attentive and pleasant and our food was delivered quickly, hot and delicious. I had the taco, burrito, enchilada combo and my hubby got a chicken fajita salad (not on the menu but they made it for him). If you like good, basic Mexican food, you will love this place as much as I do. Two thumbs up!!

euvue1WQCOWJunfEJdronw.text: Ordered the steak and chicken fajitas off of the lunch menu and it was delicious! Plenty of food served for a very reasonable price. If you're in the Ballantyne area and enjoy Mexican cuisine, I highly recommend stopping in.

S7oeXzKGlqk38i2ZTNRLlg.text: Glad Ballantyne has good Mexican food finally. Been 3 times and happy overall. Wish they would season their food more though. My chimichanga could have had peppers and onions in it. Their salsa and chips are as amazing.

s0SlgYLdpcMkuRjkDvebbw.text: Finally a decent Mexican restaurant in Indian Land! Fresh, great service, greats margs!!

dmhx238lIXWjZvEi3AQQ6g.text: The food is absolutely delicious and authentic. Service is friendly and fast. It is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte.

SUaAG1-HetNtaN8zwY5Fug.text: Good cheap Mexican food in the Ballantyne area.  Same folks who own the one on Central Ave.  Do yourself a favor and try the "Cheese Steak Burrito Dinner."  It's a large tortilla stuffed with fajita steak, grilled onions and cheese.  The whole thing is fried chimichanga style and smothered in queso (served with rice and refried beans).

D3uuOyuvQodm8OJFKHwHyQ.text: I have had better Mexican food at Taco Bell.   Being from AZ,  I have never heard of a Chimichanga not fried or Munster cheese in a burrito!  $11 bucks for two tiny unfried Chimichangas is a joke.  Service was horrible, tables sat dirty around us the entire meal,  they had a 30 minute wait even though they had multiple tables open.  Waste of time and money.   We are stopping at Wendy's on the way home.

f9Xv4IlbNPGsWfcwXjCgjg.text: Went into the restaurant yesterday and had great food and great service.  I would have given 5 stars but there was a little mistake on my bill and had to work to get it resolved.  Might have been an oversight but still was on unnecessary inconvenience..  Will be back soon!!!!

9UeiVADoKWWbkkJgw4bOpQ.text: Great Mexican Restaurant! Food & Service were wonderful!! Our server Hugo was great!!

ZjH7E40ejzHzC_QvXMZbqA.text: We have enjoyed the food at this restaurant twice and will come again. The food is very tasty with a little different flavor to their enchilada sauce than some other restaurants. Price is reasonable. They have a full bar and offer lower prices on drink specials from time to time. Chips and salsa delivered immediately. Two salsas are given, one mild and one hot. Large beverage glasses so you don't have to ask for refills all the time. Our food server brought refills without our need to ask. Very attentive. Another employee, Edgar, came to see how we were doing. He is very personable and is an asset to this restaurant. The lower rating is because of the noise level. With tile floors and open space we found it to be noisy and difficult to converse. I suggest that they lower the music to help minimize this problem. Good food, so give it a try.

vrRetSNe3PyzyHEjJi7z9w.text: Food was average in taste we were excited to have a New Mexican restaurant near us but we came out disappointed, we might give it one more try.

003edK2RevWhizwEEznvXw.text: La Unica is my favorite restaurant in ballantyne! The food is amazing & the service is great.

ZmKVvPrZfZko-ognzxL0Vw.text: We love Mexican food, and this is the top of our list now! Everyone in Ballantyne needs to try it.  Our food was delicious and very reasonable. The employees are all so nice. The management gives everyone extra attention to make you feel welcome... Can't wait to go back!

pU5SZsH3k5li_uYzh8AJGg.text: So glad to finally get a good Mexican spot out here in Ballantyne. My wife & i have already been about 5-6 times. Its our Friday night go too now!

RrRwPB_e50W1sN62kzuF8g.text: So unfortunate that my first visit to La Unica Mexican Restaurant ended with such frustration. As a vegetarian ordering a chicken burrito, with avocado being the chicken substitute, I thought the waitress and I had established one would cancel out the other. OH, NO! At LaUnica they charge for the uneaten chicken as well as the avocado. Do yourself a favor and find some other place to eat that just wants you to enjoy the meal and not just take money out of your wallet.

Wo_aWPSNGyzfMXqdGOFAGQ.text: Love this place as I lived on Central Ave 14ish years ago when 1rst opened.  Lake Norman and other locations solid as well

yWYtQBZzCYt_JepjHqXLAw.text: great mexican food great atmosphere and service love to come here when Im in ballantyne

dmnul7OLVs99zdGWmGlYag.text: Formerly La Unica on Central Ave and Hawthorne. Same terrible service, same bad food, different logo.

UrtfEps2aJwEKrlQUxQwsg.text: This is our new favorite hotspot. The service is outstanding. And the food is excellent.

3q_iqXf3nfr0c7v2fxQp1w.text: Probably some of the best Mexican food I've ever had in my life. Great service and amazing food. Highly recommend checking this place out!

o524euVG7gE3yQtZYNUtZQ.text: I guess it's all about the "Mellenials" doing their "shots" & such. We ordered "take out" based on (totally worthless) reviews we read. The food was inedible, it made me sick (as in food poisoning?). The young man who answered the phone refused to refund our money unless my much older husband would bring the food back. I'm from NYC and no, I don't drive. There was no way they were going to get away with their "take out crap". So I put the husband on the road with the disgusting, inedible food. It was the WORST handling of a situation like this I've ever dealt with. I kept asking for this guy's supervisor, he kept saying he WAS the supervisor. "Not in the business of giving away free food". Was that a professional, decent answer? We'd ordered from them before. So 73 year old husband got on the road late night and returned the pig slop that usually comes as "take out". My NJ sister in law said "never order take out, it's always crap! Wish I listened to her. So we got our refund (according to my credit card). After all the "H" I/we had to deal with, wouldn't ever deal with this restaurant which by the way can't keep their name staight. . .they answer the phone "La Unica" but now call themselves "La Autentica".  I call them "La B.S."

PKaiM-bY_VDrNufOXroyEQ.text: I came to this location thinking it would be the same as the location we went to in Indian Trail, NC. Turns out it was not. Must be a chain. Either way, the customer service was good. The server who assisted us was friendly and attentive. I went there expecting legit Mexican food and left very disappointed. It was the cheese that they used that just ruins it. I have no idea what kind of cheese they use, but it does not go well with enchiladas nor quesadillas. I had cheese enchiladas and I couldn't finish them. I noticed the same problem with the cheese at the other location in Indian Trail, but I still decided to give this location a try. I will not be returning for food. However, I may consider returning only for a casual night to have drinks and watch some sports. The ambience does look good for a good sports night. This place is loaded with huge TVs all around.

P_INTrTTusG9TjMO7_Ov_A.text: I'm very disappointed with the dishonest behavior at this place. My husband and I went there on March 25, a Sunday evening. We ordered 6 tacos to go and a young female hostess took our order. The total was $16.17. We didn't leave a tip because it was a to go order. A few days later, we were very surprising to find that our credit card was charged $21.17 for this transaction. Apparently someone added $5 tip him/herself! So be careful and make sure you double check your credit card bill if you recently went to this place!

JpMzkgLIIa2PUdz9ks7tFw.text: If you follow a vegan diet like I do, you won't be disappointed here. However, you need to ask for what you want.. the server told me that any entree can be made into a vegetarian dish and from there I asked for no cheese on this and that. I ordered the enchiladas verde....after I told the server I like mushrooms, she suggested a combination of mushrooms, spinach and zucchini in the enchiladas. At home I eat a whole foods plant-based diet with no oil, and the chef accommodated my request for no-oil also. The server didn't blink an eye and provided us with really good service.

A1MLkg007R2hS7DRoBXoJA.text: This place has became our new go to for Mexican in the area. Service is stellar! Try the No Name Plate with a jalapeno margarita! You won't be disappointed! Their chips, salsa and homemade guacamole are delish too!

KHVqmxHwHO98n132rVaPSQ.text: My Boyfriend and I came here last night and the food was Really Good and so was the service. He ordered the No Name and I had a combination platter. Both meals were really good! The place was pretty packed for a Sunday night. The portions are huge and the margaritas were too!!  Definitely will be coming back!

qRuGoCTJhePfUQ7zOuECDQ.text: Great Mexican food on Ballantyne. Music was a little loud from the live entertainment, but a very festive atmosphere, nonetheless. Food came out quickly and the drinks were reasonably priced and very good. Service was also on point. Definitely looking forward to going back!

5mPiNebzhSfnUHL8LMO_5A.text: Well we found out it was a chain today but that's still okay. La Unica is one of our go to reasonably priced Mexican restaurants and now that they on Lancaster Highway we're able to go there a lot more often. Good food, nice people, and you still have money in your pocket when you leave.

4Iz_9cqcXuQoFfTdZN9NAw.text: Cute almost cafeteria style place. The food was like Taco Bell but served to you. Our server was nice. The drinks were mostly juice, little alcohol. We got tequila shots because the drinks were so bad and the tequila was watered down. I get restaurants want to preserve their liquor by putting water in the bottle but this was too much. If you're looking for fast food imitation Mexican in a cute local spot then this would work.

3U3r7cEsF3JNzyba8DusVQ.text: Mexican food, and what defines good Mexican food is something my wife and I consider ourselves snobs on. She grew up 5 miles from the southern border in California, and I spent a good chunk of my life there. Finding real Mexican food and not Tex-Mex has always been a challenge for us. La Unica definitely serves REAL Mexican food. There are authentic offerings to on the menu, and even more important, authentic taste that hit the table. Their chorizo dip is incredible by the way. Our waiter was quick to greet us and made some good suggestions. They brought out 3 types of salsa including an avocado salsa verde that was really good too. Portions were big, hot and came out at the perfect time. They even had live music!  Awesome experience. We're going back soon.

1omqalfyiNAJNIuvldwTHQ.text: Found a huge bone in my chicken. They didn't comp my meal or anything after speaking with three workers. Gross. Never going back.

Fwjl9-J0zDF89SyPRZcX5Q.text: Food not good sorry, margaritas good but  price too high, disappointed won't go back too bad

lSX9Y9XQw3MHVzLslt9B-w.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant. They catered a party 40+ people at my home. On time, reasonably priced and the BEST customer service. This will be my go to mexican restaurant. So many great compliments on the food.

z7Ugqh4Ebdhe_fzowh0IYQ.text: First time here, great fajitas and tacos! From Ohio finally a good margarita! We will definitely be back. Great waiter, Alex!

9v0BR7W8SWGObweIrqmAwA.text: Horrible! If I can give a "0" I would. They don't use real cheese...you heard me right! Cheese enchiladas with cheese spreads. Refried bean and Mexican Rice are supposed to be vegetarian...sure doesn't taste like that. Never again!!!

8x4eoq1HGNz95u-oszQ1vg.text: Trying to find a good Mexican restaurant in the area but, even though I really wanted to give this guys a good score, I visited them one more time but left disappointed by "tasteless" chicken fajitas, my wife left half of her ensalada because no matter how much sauce she added, was still not good and my kids basically eating from the kids menu and even though I didn't try their food, it didn't look appetizing... pale chicken and fries... like I said, I really wanted to like their food, but left disappointed again.  Service is good, and their location is ok since they are hidden in a small shopping mall.  I'll keep trying other restaurants in the area.  Like I said, good people working there, but, their food needs to improve dramatically.

FdSDrPa924yQlRAGl_Xp-A.text: Loud, loud and LOUDER!! I will remember this restaurant for its painfully loud, thumping, dance-club like music along with its totally bland and tasteless guacamole, bland refried beans, bland mild salsa and gratuitously spicy hot salsa. The employees were super nice and friendly and were on the spot for everything you could possibly need, but the volume of the music and flavorless food will be why we don't return. Seems I may be alone in my opinion here on Yelp, but that was our experience. Shame.

BlXAYtBKSr95SRt-KF8XxA.text: This could very well be a one-star rating, but it was our first time here and I generally give three-stars if it is A-OK; but La Unica (the only one in English) just might be the only one that came across that way...in a negative sense.  Newly opened we went for lunch.  It was 1pm, so the lunch mob had vacated and there was just one table of six Latinos finishing and two other tables occupied.  Seated, we waited for 15 minutes until our waiter came to our table.  The long wait was a surprise as there were at least four wait persons wandering around, but I guess assigned tables are just that.  The menu looked pretty good.  Lots of selections broken down by category, a lunch menu, a drink menu and a listing of sides.  Pretty much an array you would expect from a Mexican/Latino restaurant.  Attractive and interesting.  We begged off the waiter who came back for more time to read the menu.  Big mistake as he was gone for quite a bit of time.  While gone from our table a couple of ladies were seated nearby, at one of his tables, as he was right on top of their order, got their drinks and did respond to our waving of arms and approached our table to take our order.  Another long wait.  By now it was 1:35 and we were thinking of leaving.  I ordered the Speedy Gonzales special (ironic given how long we languished at our table!).  This was a carnita taco, a cheese enchalada and beans.  You have a choice of beans or rice, and it is extra if you want both.  Wife ordered another special of a chili rellano with beans.  We both had iced tea and those were $2.65 each.  Should have gone for booze!  Again a long wait for the order to appear.  The table with the two women already had their order served while we waited.  They had ordered after we did.  The slow kitchen confirmed to my wife and I that the theme of La Unica was the word "slow."  The food was so-so.  My taco was a room temperature corn tortilla with dry pork pieces and a bit of lettuce.  The encilada just lay dead on the plate, cheese had already solidified and their red sauce was more like a chipolte flavored canned sauce.    Wife's chili rellano was pretty good.  Stuffed with cheese, that was melted, and the chili was not heavily breaded.  Excellent.    We both agreed that their beans were very good.  Not totally mashed into paste like found in many Latino restaurants, these were partially mashed but leaving a good amount of beans whole.  And they were flavorful.  Go for the beans v. rice.  We paid at 2:16pm, so the uncrowded lunch took over an hour.  Oddly, we noticed that our receipt showed that we paid at 1:16pm or maybe that was when our waiter took our drink order?  Our neighbors, along with some of the Yelpers rating, gave this place raves.  This is just NOT a five-star experience which equals "as good as it gets."  Golly!  At least one Yelper did mention how slow they were.  We will give it another chance, but I just hate to think that I might pay for another less than satisfactory experience.

EYoWEiPXJQzLm1wbHbT0kA.text: It would have been 5 stars... except for they didn't have enough menus..and it was 45 minutes to actually get food.  However- it was at their peak time Saturday night.  Food REALLY good.  And if you order the Queso- the large is "ridiculously" LARGE.  Staff awesome, atmosphere was comfortable - we will be back

HlQ3F0U4_es3YysljBOl5w.text: Take-out orders BEWARE.  Now we have had issues in the past (Kids meal being wrong multiple times as well as a few other inconveniences), but nothing we haven't been able to overlook. Tonight really took it to a new level of absurdity though.  To avoid the saddened face of a child that looks like we just broke their favorite toy, we have learned to check our order EVERY time before we leave the parking lot. 5 orders called in: Order # 1 - WRONG Order # 2 - WRONG Order # 3 - WRONG Order # 4 - WRONG Order # 5 - Wait, how did this happen....it's actually what I ordered! Oh, but no Chips and salsa were ready to go. We had to ask. After numerous attempts to correct the order we still ended up with a missing entree in the end after arriving home.  Called the restaurant in the hopes they would make things right.  While it took some time they offered a full refund.  Queue hubby to go pick it up.  Enter restaurant, give name and gentleman (manager?) is waved over.  He casually asks if cash was OK, to which I responded, Yes.  A $20 bill is handed to me.  I don't move, but look at the register and say 'full refund' was promised.  Employees are called in for a "huddle" as they all look at each other confused.  A full refund is begrudgingly handed over with shaking heads and negative looks from the huddle.   That's it for me! I'm out!  Damn shame as the food is good, but can't deal with the terrible service any more.

Z-AvGajKumdGa7hhit4uhA.text: The food is amazing.... They have 17 TVs and they are getting the football package... A great environment and everyone is extremely friendly. They have good Mexican food at reasonable prices.   Try this place out...

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome drink.....
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States

O9QDGuSQrozuC1j76YZrPA.text: I ordered the chicken burrito. It wasn't the greatest and tasted like defrosted meat inside. My husband ordered the fajita burrito and it was a little better but not great. Even for a lower end restaurant this one has pretty bad tasting food. Sorry.

oHfInyS0jYXSKnqtux4pWQ.text: First visit there tonight for dinner. Yummy chips and salsa. Beware...the hot salsa has quite the kick. Lots of choices on the menu. Food was good. Had live music on Friday night. Great experience!

SY036UeNj8om7ajiYZQDgg.text: One word.....ceviche!!! La Autentica is our new favorite Mexican joint in Ballantyne. We had friends suggest this place because they knew how much we enjoy a good ceviche and it did not disappoint. Super fresh tasting and the portion size is just amazing. In fact, we normally end up taking a to-go box home and enjoying again the next day sitting poolside. But it's not only the ceviche....the tacos are phenomenal as well!!! And of course, the one thing that is a make or break is the chips and salsa....theirs is just perfect. You get a mild and a hot version with their crunchy, corny chips. Simply perfect! And the icing on the proverbial cake is cold Juicy Jay on tap at a very reasonable price. Go try this place and support this spot. It seems this space has been jinxed in the past, as many different restaurants have come and gone....let's make this one a permanent fixture. Cheers!

v5Zk_LhzH5-wHXPXeCfNaQ.text: Finally!!!  Great authentic Mexican in Ballantyne!!  Love this place. Hot chips, great salsa, cold margaritas. Just perfect. Cute interior and cozy booths. Really loved this spot. Can't wait to go back.

yfBRKMkr-_I034o9tk8q_g.text: I've been to a couple of these places, every time I see one, I stop and eat. Love their food! I'd say I'm a Mexican food snob, growing up in Southern California, with an ex wife from Jalisco, I've been exposed to some pretty good Mexican food, this place rocks!

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States

5Vh5Y6qPRyYfRpgv2CguOQ.text: Good food but they will very often overcharge you for things you didn't want, or things you didn't get. Be careful with them and always check your tab before you pay.

tXcKE9xB4WngEyqO2kFMrQ.text: We really loved this Mexican restaurant! I had a soft flour ground beef taco and a side of rice and beans. They were tasty and plentiful. My husband had the barbacoa quesadilla and a carne asada taco. The quesadilla was KILLER!!! Such tender meat and the cheese made it so meaty and delicious. Over all the food was great and the service even better. Our chips and salsa came right away. They give you mild and spicy salsa. Both were really good, but be warned the spicy is really hot! The servers were very attentive with refilling our drinks and once we ordered our food we had it in like 5 minutes. It was all hot and fresh. Also, the prices at this restaurant are awesome! We will definitely be back again and again.

WlICs9tXGIRJKwqhORf98g.text: My new favorite go to Mexican.  The skinny margarita is amazing!! They have a good authentic beer selection on tap.  All of their food is good. The authentic tacos are delicious and on special on Tuesday's.  The burrito La Unica with Asada (steak) is yummy.  The whole place is clean.  You won't be disappointed.

ZqfZlVTn4NqYkwcd-8m3tw.text: Pleasantly surprised with the food , tacos were delicious, beer was cold . Service was ok, our waitress disappear at one point but she made it up giving us fresh hot chips to go with our left over guacamole haha We will be back! Taco Tuesday for sure!!

caAKhfPQgsoP9paJzhkGtQ.text: Great food! Authentic mexican menu and awesome service, too. We  came on a Saturday afternoon and enjoyed live, instrumental music. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Live music and lively atmosphere on a Saturday afternoon

cS9YGeTG6yl-mqXG64xpFg.text: We love this place.  Not only is it close enough to walk it it totally worth going.  We have a "table" that we request and our waitress Stephanie is attentive and always encourages us to try new options from the menu.  They will tweak anything to your taste or liking....just ask.  The staff and owner are very friendly and we are always treated kindly. Carlos, the bartender, makes fantastic margaritas and the beer is always cold and ready.   It is a must try if you are in the area and if your not it is totally worth the drive.   They have TVs for football and an outdoor seating area that is dog friendly as well.  Sometimes in weekends they even have live music.  Food and drink specials nightly.

CoIHbegSerMTgS-lxlMg5A.text: First visit and was pleasantly surprised. Went in to get take out and everyone was very friendly. Sat at the bar and had a Corona Light on draft (bonus!) while I waited. The place was empty when I first got there, but filled up quickly. My food was prompt and order was 100% correct. Got it home and my husband and I both agreed that everything was really good! We ordered 3 different kinds of tacos, Carnitas, Asada and Pollo and the steak was a bit chewy, but other than that, they were great! We also had chips, salsa and queso, all delicious.

qyI7XZhR6vrrEO2zOzKORA.text: Went on a Tuesday since In the questions above the manager says there are $1 tacos and $6 margaritas, not the case. This is a major family chain vibe restaurant. We ordered 2 jalapeno margaritas ($7 each) and received a fishbowl Of lime juice, no alcohol, so we politely asked the bartender to re make them with tequila Cointreau and lime juice as a margarita should be, the next drinks were great and the food was good. Then we got the bill, $12 dollars for each margarita!! Will not be back.

-90BP4mfAHy3BsXOGh1U8w.text: Not a very chill environment I think it is the lighting however the food was awesome.

s7MgzAw6mxl6oGZuQLtBXg.text: This is seriously the best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to! The food is amazing! The staff is very attentive and helpful. The location is extremely convenient too! I tried it for the first time today and was very impressed. I HIGHLY recommend it! Steak and chicken fajitas are to die for! Give it a try- you won't regret it!

XMF_JZQQks4fUaKuNkjfUg.text: Come check it out it's a lot of fun. And don't forget to say hello to Carlos and he will make you a kick ass margarita

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. If you want to have some fun tacos and some nice drinks it is a very nice place to come. But come and check out the menu.

bkIsHWvJgSHwoj8-Z4ugbw.text: This place has had a recent change in ownership along with a new name, now called La Victoria.   We stopped by for dinner and it was so delicious! I'm surprised I could even eat my meal after all the chips and salsa I devoured. My wife and I eat A LOT of salsa when we go for Mexican food and loved that this place brings out the large carafe of salsa so we don't have to ask 100 times for more salsa. It was also very tasty salsa, which is probably one of the most important things at a Mexican restaurant.  I had chicken fajitas for the main meal and my wife had a combo. The fajitas were very good, and I loved that they weren't all greasy like some other places. Plus they were a large portion for the price with some leftover for tomorrow. I had a few bites of my wife's combo and it was also delicious. The ground beef had a great flavor and wasn't super salty.   The service was also great, the wait staff was very friendly and helped in every way possible. The new owner was previously at La Unica in Matthews, which is also very good. He's super friendly and always has a smile on his face.  If you are looking for a good Mexican spot or love salsa like we do, this is a great spot to try!

vBMZqpLfCFgFG8h5Hx4r1w.text: This already the best Mexican joint in the area but when you throw in $1 Authentic Taco Tuesday fuh-getta-bout-it, I'm all in for 5! Didn't realize it however until I saw the sign riding north on 521. I could not stop soon enough!  Authentic tacos but are nothing like what most of us know as traditional American tacos. They're very simple, served open faced on a soft tortilla with only your choice of meat, cilantro and onions. No cheese, tomatoes or anything else.  I went with three shredded chicken, a shredded beef and a pork. They were all perfectly savory. Will be back (next Tuesday).

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Authentic tacos
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Warning: Hot means hot

KkEO5Cn0dMxIGW7BWyn75A.text: You must get the Margaritas!   Imagine this: It's Friday, you've had a long week and so has your husband. All you want to do is go out to dinner and relax. You decide on La Authentica.  You walk in,  and ask if there is a warmer section of the restaurant you can sit in because  you're chilly. The hostess and your husband both look at you like...what? And you realize you're being ridiculous and the hostess is being very nice. You're offered a seat outside but you'd rather be inside.   You and your husband are immediately seated at a booth and you order some guacamole,  you get some chips and salsa as well and you order 2 frozen margaritas.  The margaritas are huge and they are strong and delicious. The chips are warm and the guacamole and salsa are great.   You're getting buzzed after only a few sips as you realize you've made the right choice for a Friday night-- a very important decision. At this point,  not much can go wrong.  Especially when you realize those huge margaritas were only about 5 or 6$ a piece.   The chips and guacamole and salsa are plenty and you are just enjoying yourself.  And then,  you order some fajitas and some tacos. And the waitress is super sweet. The food comes and tastes fresh,  but you can't finish it.  So,  you get boxes.   Obviously you left some room for dessert.  So you order tres leches and it's a huge slice and you finish it sooo quickly because its absolutely delicious!!  And then you ask for the check and everything you ordered is only 56$ and you're happy.  And you leave full,  buzzed and relaxed with left overs.  Perfect end to a long week.  Now that's a perfect Happy Friday!

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trespass leches
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fajitas
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fajitas

CO2StP-ym-n0C6hw8_2M-w.text: Of all the Mexican restaurants in the Ballantyne area, La Autentica is far and away my favorite. This is the third, maybe fourth, restaurant in what has been a seemingly problematic location for businesses. I've been to La Autentica probably a dozen more times than my visits to all the prior restaurants combined.  The food is excellent. Their lunch portion of Tacos de Asada is perfect and includes rice and beans. The first photo shown on Yelp is actually one of my photos of their Tacos de Asada from one of my early visits. The tacos are authentic "Mexican street tacos"; two soft corn tortillas, tender bites of steak, cilantro and onions. Simple food, but delicious.  Upon arrival you'll be brought two red salsas in small carafes, one spicy (it's the one with more of the pepper's seeds showing) and a more mild salsa. I like to combine the two to blend a salsa with a hint of a kick. Ask for their salsa verde as well, and you'll be brought out a small carafe of a spicy green salsa with bits of avocado in it. It's also delicious, although it's become much hotter since they opened. I prefer it a little milder, but it tastes so good I plow through it anyway, much to the dismay of my stomach.  I've never had bad service here during lunch and it's been pretty consistent for dinner with only a couple of early misses. I tried the quesadilla on my first visit and was unimpressed, so switched to the tacos on my next visit and haven't looked back.  I'm docking one star simply because getting delivery or takeout from La Autentica is hit or miss. I've ordered via Door Dash and over the phone and I've run into issues each time. Ordering via Door Dash, you have to purchase chips and salsa for a few bucks. That on top of the delivery charge makes it not worthwhile, especially when, after paying a few extra bucks for chips and salsa, they skimp on the salsa and chips included in the order.  We tried ordering directly via phone, and asking for the chips and salsa with our order, and weren't charged, which is nice. However, there were other issues.. Their "lunch" tacos de asada comes with rice and beans and two tacos. The dinner portion is three tacos, no rice or beans. You can order the "lunch portion" at dinner, for a dollar more, but it's confusing. When I ordered over the phone directly, I specified the lunch portion but got the version without the rice or beans, which wasn't what I was looking for at all. My husband went back to get some refried beans (I had just had a tooth extracted, could barely eat anything and was SO looking forward to the beans that night) and they gave him a hard time, but they were busy on a weekend night.  Now when we want carryout, we go to the restaurant in person and place our order with the menu in front of us so there's no discrepancy. It's an inconvenient step to have to take, but the food is worth it, and in person everything works out much better!

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch Tacos de Asada includes rice and beans. Ask for the salsa Verde!

Ct9kM8_VmyVO9dAQPXn2AA.text: Walking in I was expecting it to be another restaurant, apparently the ownership has change thus the name change. I proceeded to give it a try despite going in to eat at another restaurant. I got authentica asada tacos with beans in rice. While the service was good and staff was attentive... I was highly disappointed in the food. The tacos had little flavor and the asada was dry. It wasn't my favorite Mexican restaurant and probably sadly despite the close location won't be my first choice to go to.

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States

B9QnECDX65nOEml1OXW5zQ.text: This is a great place to get a quality lunch. I don't know how of the place is actually "authentic", but the food certainly seems to be. I had the soft tacos and they were spot-on. My spouse had the fajitas and they seemed to be okay (not like what we've experience before at other places where they come out from the kitchen sizzling). Never-the-less, both entrees were very good.   The place was not crowded when we got there (before the lunch crowd), but by the time we left a fair number of people also came in. Prices were good and service was good as well. We would definitely go back!

8jKalqlrFwGZLtsRxPcSWw.text: A great way to spend a Ballantyne excursion after a great experience with Pastor Steven Furtick, Kari and Cody.. all at Elevation Church. This is the first time I've been back to this restaurant since the name change to La Victoria, and this place never disappoints! Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere.

bN9cKbV__20rSse0jZGzLw.text: The best Mexican restaurant in Vallantyne area. Fresh food, grate prices and amazing service

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States

thYqkH-YUxpt5kZ3WpZ5TQ.text: Brought my mom here because she lovesssss tacos.. and esp Taco Tuesday's! At $1, naturally we had to try everything! Really enjoyed the al pastor and carnitas, but not so much everything else. When I ordered, the waitress mentioned that we were required to order drinks in order to get the $1 Taco Tuesday deal. Neither of us drink sodas or teas so ordered drinks, but barely touched them. I rather they put a minimum on number of tacos you have to get since we thought the drinks were just a waste. Also wasn't a fan of the service. I had to get up several times to request more chips, ask for to-go containers, etc. Think I rather stick to my other taco Tuesday favorites but may come back to try the other dishes.

z3zXQtY_i0iSzCNlCeGJ1w.text: Not the best around Indian Land, but very good with great margarita's and good service.

Z9ZX1ojqnmMO_wIMzZFu2Q.text: Came here for lunch with a girlfriend and had a better experience here. We each ordered off of the lunch menu and it was delicious. I love their hot chunky salsa. I also like their green salsa. I think you have to ask for it. We didn't wait long for our food and service was good!

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Speedy Gonzalez
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch special #7
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese enchilada, bean burrito Chile relleno

Ur6g6qtvtzKf5pUZ9uT4Yw.text: Typically we like this restaurant.   However,  the food was rushed and not very good!    Ordered fajitas...rice, beans,etc came out 10 minutes before steak and chicken.   Tortillas were wrong and replaced later.    Steak was very tough!!!!!! By the time steak/chicken arrived rice and beans were lukewarm.  Told bartender and waitress.   Bartender even picked up burnt meat to show waitress.    However, neither attempted any option, etc  Waitress was trying but...after tonight, not sure if we will go back.  Very disappointed!!!!!

A78sNnnxcrq8Y3TU_Uz1HQ.text: Service - Amazing! I wish I could remember our servers' name. He was absolutely amazing.  Food - Good. Portion size was perfect.  Margarita - Perfect Price - Good   No complaints, I will return next time I am in Charlotte!

46X5ObmJRxG6DsXglMStxA.text: Now named La Victoria. My last two visits have been much better. Apparently they now have a liquor license and the menu has been updated for the first time in a long time. New signage is up and the food quality is better. My last two lunch meals have been the best I have had there since it was La Unica and La Autentica. Most lunch meals are $6.99. I will go back.

-j4yEPWusqGiTAKuKy1iqQ.text: The atmosphere is lively and upbeat, the staff is friendly and the food is really good. The house margaritas are taste. I will be returning!

BwjWkcsO_w0_XXoVazgOtA.text: Not the most authentic Mexican joint but definitely worth a visit. Taco Tuesdays gets u 1$ tacos with the purchase of a drink which is great. Al pastor and carnitas were my favs. They give you free tortilla chips with a choice of 3 sauces mild hot and the green which is great with pieces of avocado in it. Will be coming back to try the rest!

photos.caption: Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of La Autentica - Charlotte, NC, United States

q1du84Cu7lnA25DSsQt0rQ.text: Just wanted to let everyone know La Autentica is now called La Victoria.  Same great food and menu, but Victor is now one of the owners instead of just the manager.  Best Mexican food in the area and you can't beat the prices for what you get!

GueEg172l3l7YR5Zx6hPVA.text: Formerly, La Unica.  I LOVE this place.  Everything is always so clean, fresh, and delicious.  This is definitely my go to mexican restaurant.  It could be yours too because they have multiple locations all across Charlotte.  They always give you a mild and a hot salsa, which I love mixing together.  They also have a green salsa (which is super spicy) that you can ask for (no charge) which has avocado chunks in it as well.  They have the best tasting chimichanga!  I always get the chicken chimichanga because it's SOO delicious!  It's always so fresh that it tastes healthy! It's located in a little shopping center, but don't let that fool you because the quality of food is amazing.  If you haven't been yet, I highly recommend coming here ASAP!

eTtbLt2mS46a0BVVDHpdWw.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant. Best authentic tacos in Charlotte. Great service and live music.

Ia7xeS5SnLybCKKo9hp6kA.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant. My husband and I regularly come here and are never disappointed. The service is excellent. The food is always hot, tasty and plentiful. The chips come as soon as you sit down and are hot! The margaritas are big and strong. The prices are cheap. Need I say more??
